com.diffplug.common.base

Class TreeNode<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.diffplug.common.base.TreeNode<T>

  • public class TreeNode<T>
extends Object
    Class for manually constructing a tree, or for copying an existing tree.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TreeNode(TreeNode<T> parent, T content)
      Creates a TreeNode with the given parent and content.
      TreeNode(TreeNode<T> parent, T content, int childCapacity)
      Creates a TreeNode with the given parent, content, and initial child capacity.

    • Constructor Detail

      • TreeNode

        public TreeNode(TreeNode<T> parent,
                T content)
        Creates a TreeNode with the given parent and content. Automatically adds itself as a child of its parent.

      • TreeNode

        public TreeNode(TreeNode<T> parent,
                T content,
                int childCapacity)
        Creates a TreeNode with the given parent, content, and initial child capacity. Automatically adds itself as a child of its parent.

        childCapacity is provided strictly for performance reasons.

                                     T root,
                                     Function<? super T,? extends R> mapper)
        Creates a hierarchy of TreeNodes that copies the structure and content of the given tree, using mapper to calculate the content of the nodes.

      • treeDef

        public static <T> TreeDef.Parented<TreeNode<T>> treeDef()
        TreeDef.Parented for TreeNodes.

      • createTestData

        public static TreeNode<String> createTestData(String... testData)
        Creates a hierarchy of TreeNode<String> using an easy-to-read array of strings.

        Spaces are used to represent parent / child relationships, e.g. 

         TreeNode<String> root = createTestData(
     "root",
     " bigNode1",
     " bigNode2",
     "  child1",
     "  child2",
     " bigNode3"
 );
        There can only be one root node, and that is the node that is returned.

      • findByPath

        public TreeNode<T> findByPath(T... path)
        Finds a child TreeNode based on its path.

        Searches the child nodes for the first element, then that node's children for the second element, etc.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no such node exists

      • findByPath

        public TreeNode<T> findByPath(List<T> path)
        See Also:
        findByPath(Object...)

      • findByContent

        public TreeNode<T> findByContent(T content)
        Searches breadth-first for the TreeNode with the given content.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if no such node exists
